ammonia 
sensors in the machine room as well as sensors in selected cold storage areas, and automatic shutdown systems.  In addition, the majority of the ammonia is maintained inside 
the engine room and just outside of the machine room (condensers).  All pressure vessels are equipped with pressure relief valves to protect the vessel\rquote s integrity during extreme pressure conditions. 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid8524708 
\par In addition to the Uniform Mechanical Code, the facility operates in }{\f1\fs16\insrsid5711303 accordance}{\f1\fs16\insrsid8524708  with the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines.  In particular, the IIAR Bulletin 110 \'93
Startup, Inspection, and Maintenance of Ammonia Refrigeration Systems\'94 is used as the basis for the facility\rquote s maintenance program.  
\par 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid815437 FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY}{\f1\fs16\insrsid8524708 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid815437 
\par There have been no ammonia accidents at the facility, including any reportable releases during the previous 5 year period (since 2003).  
\par 
\par EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
\par 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 The Bashas\rquote  Distribution Center has an Emergency action plan in effect at the facility.  The Emergency Action Plan (Plan) is detail in the Emergency Planning and Response section of the PSM/RMP docu
ment as well as in the facility\rquote s general Emergency Response Plan: a self-contained document located and maintained onsite.  These plans were designed to meet the following objectives:}{\f1\fs16\insrsid815437 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 
\par {\listtext\pard\plain\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 \hich\af1\dbch\af0\loch\f1 1.\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-360\li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\jclisttab\tx720\faauto\ls16\rin0\lin720\itap0\pararsid16334744 {\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 To save lives
\par {\listtext\pard\plain\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 \hich\af1\dbch\af0\loch\f1 2.\tab}To minimize and avoid injuries
\par {\listtext\

pard\plain\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 \hich\af1\dbch\af0\loch\f1 3.\tab}To protect the environment
\par {\listtext\pard\plain\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 \hich\af1\dbch\af0\loch\f1 4.\tab}To minimize property damage
\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0\pararsid16334744 {\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 
\par Bashas\rquote  Distribution Center maintains a safety committee whose member are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The }{\f1\fs16\insrsid6452601 p}{\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 lan}{\f1\fs16\insrsid6452601 s}{\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 
 provide the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise }{\f1\fs16\insrsid6452601 
at the facility.  These plans are reviewed and updated at least once per year.  These plans were reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate facility changes.  }{\f1\fs16\insrsid16334744 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid6452601 
\par Bashas\rquote  Distribution Center has coordinated emergency response efforts with the local fire department and with the contract refrigeration operation and maintenance firm.  In the case of an ammonia-related emergency, it is the policy of Bashas
\rquote  Distribution Center to evacuate and to allow the fire department to respond to the emergency.  The refrigeration contractor will be available for guidance and assistance. 
\par 
\par PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY\tab 
\par 
\par A three year compliance audit was completed in August of 2006 resulting in multiple recommendations to improve safety and implementation of the Risk Management Programs.  All of the mitigation measures listed below are scheduled for completion}{
\f1\fs16\insrsid8129400  no later than August of 2007.  }{\f1\fs16\insrsid6452601 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid8129400 
\par The recommendations for the

par 
\par The Bashas' Distribution Center facility has an emergency action plan in effect.  The Emergency Action Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Planning and Response section of the PSM/R
MP document which is maintained at the facility and updated as necessary.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:
\par 1.) To save lives.
\par 2.) To minimize and avoid injuries.
\par 3.) to protect the environment.
\par 4.) to minimize property damage. 
\par 
\par Ba
shas' Distribution Center maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitig
ation procedures which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated as needed.
\par 
\par Bashas' Distribution Center has coordinated emergency response efforts with the local fi
re department and with teh contracted refrigeration operation and maintenance firm.  In the case of an ammonia-related emergency, it is the policy of Bashas' Distribution Center to evacuate and to allow the fire department to respond to the emergency.  Th
e refrigeration contractor will be available for guidance and assistance.  
\par 
\par STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
\par 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid2448718 T}{\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 h}{\f1\fs16\insrsid2448718 e}{\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
 facility including the ammonia refrigeration system at Bashas' Distribution Center was constructed in 1991.  Expansions of the facili
ty have occurred in 1998, 2003, and in 2005 with the most recent expansion incorporating an ice cream freezer extension.  The Bashas' Distribution Center is located at 200 South 56th Street in Chandler, Arizona 85226.  The system was constructed in accord
ance with all applicable federal, state

and local regulations including the Uniform Fire and Mechanical Codes. 
\par 
\par The Bashas' Distribution Center facility receives and distributes food and food products to the following retail grocery outlets:  Bashas', Food City, and AJ's Fine Foods. 
\par 
\par The two ammonia refrigeration systems are used for warehouse cold storage, includi
ng dock operations and freezer storage.  The initial system maintains an inventory of approximately 12,800 pounds of ammonia, and the second refrigeration system is designed for an inventory of 19,900 pounds of ammonia. 
\par 
\par Each refrigeration system utilizes a }{\f1\fs16\insrsid2448718\charrsid11096045 separate}{\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
 engine room in which most of the refrigeration equipment, including vessels, pumps, and compressors are housed. Condensers are mounted on the roof of each engine room and the evaporators are located in their respective cold storage rooms/areas.
\par 
\par HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY
\par 
\par The Hazard Assessment was updated based on the installation of the new refrigeration system scheduled to startup in January 2003. Since the ammonia inventory in the new system is designed to be 19,900 the Worst Case Scenario wa
s updated to account for the potentially greater risk versus the first refrigeration system. The potentially-impacted }{\f1\fs16\insrsid2448718\charrsid11096045 population}{\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
 for each scenario was re-estimated using the most recent data from the 2000 census.  The population and environmental receptors were also investigated and documented based on current information.
\par 
\par {\listtext\pard\plain\f3\fs16\charrsid11096045 \loch\af3\dbch\af0\hich\f3 \'b7\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-360\li360\ri0\nowidctlpar\jclisttab\tx360\faauto\ls15\rin0\lin360\itap0\pararsid8411653 {\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
Worst Case Release Result Summary
\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\ita

p0 {\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
\par \tab Scenarion Description: Release of the maximum quantity of ammonia that can be stored in a vessel (Low Stage }{\f1\fs16\insrsid2782879\charrsid11096045 Suction Accumulator) \endash  19,000 pounds in 10 minutes.  The enclosure of the}{
\f1\fs16\insrsid1015284\charrsid11096045  ammonia engine room provides a passive mitigation that limits the release rate to the atmosphere.  The most pessimistic meteorological conditions were used:
 1.5 meters per second wind speed, and F visibility.  The Risk Manageme}{\f1\fs16\insrsid8411653\charrsid11096045 
nt Program Guidance for Ammonia Refrigeration reference tables were used to determine the maximum distance to the toxic endpoint of 200 ppm in urban conditions.  This release reaches off site and may impact population receptors.  No environmental receptor
s were affected by this potential release.  Further details regarding the Worst Case Scenario can be found in the Hazard Assessment report maintained in Volume IV of the PSM/RMP at the facility. }{\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid8411653\charrsid11096045 
\par 
\par {\listtext\pard\plain\f3\fs16\insrsid8411653\charrsid11096045 \loch\af3\dbch\af0\hich\f3 \'b7\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-360\li360\ri0\nowidctlpar\jclisttab\tx360\faauto\ls9\rin0\lin360\itap0\pararsid8411653 {\f1\fs16\insrsid8411653\charrsid11096045 
Worst Case Release Result Summary}{\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0\pararsid8411653 {\f1\fs16\insrsid8411653\charrsid11096045 
\par To ensure conservative results, the reported Alternative Release Scenario was not changed from the initial RMP submitted in 1999, as the impact}{\f1\fs16\insrsid8206275 s }{\f1\fs16\insrsid8411653\charrsid11096045 
from the previous scenario were potentially greater. 
\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\f1\fs16\insrsid14247696\charrsid11096045 
\par }{

\f1\fs16\insrsid8411653\charrsid11096045 \tab Scenario Description: A release of ammonia resulting from a 1/4 inch diameter hole in a pipe.  The release rate of ammonia doe to the pressure of the tank is 13
4 pounds per minute.   The meteorological conditions used were 3 meters per second wind speed, and D stability. The Risk Management Program Guidance for Ammonia Refrigeration reference tables were used to determine the maximum distance to 
the toxic endpoint of 200 ppm in rural conditions. This release reaches offsite and may impact population receptors.  No environmental receptors were affected by this potential release. 
\par 
\par ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
\par 
\par The }{\f1\fs16\insrsid11425335 Bashas\rquote  Distribution Center ammonia refrigeration systems have many safety features.   Much of the safety of the systems is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of each system.  For 
example, the Bashas\rquote  Distribution Center facility operates in accordance with OSHA\rquote s Process Safety Management regulation. }{\f1\fs16\insrsid8411653 
\par }{\f1\fs16\insrsid11425335 
\par Bashas\rquote  maintains an on-going contract with a professional refrigeration service firm.  The refrigeration contractors make regular preventative maintenance }{\f1\fs16\insrsid8206275 visits}{\f1\fs16\insrsid11425335  to the 
facility, ensuring the refrigeration equipment is maintained in a good state of repair.  Major repairs are competed on a priority }{\f1\fs16\insrsid8206275 basis;}{\f1\fs16\insrsid11425335  ensuring safety is a top priority.
\par 
\par The Bashas\rquote  Distribution Center facility including the ammonia refrigeration systems were designed and constructed in accordance with the Uniform Mechanical Code which specifically outlines requirements for the safe operation of ammoni
a refrigeration systems.  These safety features in each system include a water diffusion tank,
